Class ChainReaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • ChainReaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ChainReaction
extends javafx.application.Application
implements java.io.Serializable
    This is the outermost, main class which encloses everything else as well as extends Application.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ChainReaction.Board
      This class is the main class which represents the Board and the current game being played on the board.
      class  ChainReaction.Cell
      This class represents a single cell of the game board.
      class  ChainReaction.InvalidMoveException
      This class is for Exceptions where an invalid move is made by the player.
      class  ChainReaction.Player
      This class represents a player, with each having his own instance.
      class  ChainReaction.Point<T>
      This class is used for Point objects of the same (but any) type.

    • Method Detail

      • settings

        public void settings(ChainReaction.Board board,
                     javafx.scene.Scene menuScene)
        Displays the settings page from the main menu

        This method creates a new scene that has settings options and switches the stage to that scene

        Contains players names and color pickers so that players can change their colours

        Parameters:
        board - The Board object that contains the array of players
        menuScene - The Scene that has main menu so that user can exit out of settings

      • menu

        public void menu()
        Displays the main menu on the screen at the start of the game

        This method creates a new scene and switches the stage to that scene

        Contains drop downs to select size of game, select number of players, settings and play button

      • showPopup

        public void showPopup(java.lang.String title,
                      java.lang.String message)
        Displays a popup on the screen

        This method creates a new window with a title and a message and displays the window when function in called

        Parameters:
        title - The string that becomes the title of the window
        message - The message that becomes the error message that the popup displals

      • getRectangleCenter

        public ChainReaction.Point<java.lang.Double> getRectangleCenter(int row,
                                                                int column)
        Returns center of rectangle at given row and column

        Returns a Point object containing the center of rectangle

        Parameters:
        row - The row where rectangle is located
        column - The column where rectangle is located
        Returns:
        Point object (row, column) containing center of rectange
